I've been playing ksp alot recently and i was wondering what multiplayer is like. It's going to be a kethane race thing where you have to get the amount required to win.

(You need kethane mod)

These are the rules:

-A turn is one mission (e.g. Land a miner on the moon, attack the opponents ship) and if it's failed you cannot re-try it (except if you're testing it on the launchpad)

-You cannot switch to the opponents ship (this is classed as spying)

-Your ship has to have your initials in its name (e.g. [KKA])

-No other mods can be used

-Part clipping is allowed only when a part won't attach

-Cheats can't be used (obviously)

-You only have a limit of 20 Kerbals (if they die, you lose)

Tell me if you want to play with me or if you want to change the rules.

That too, but I think the ease of access provided by dropbox is good. If you have downloaded their app, it syncs automatically every time the contents of the shared folder are updated so we upload it in the following format: <savegame name>-<date of turn>

That gives us a record of all saves uploaded and you can then download the correct one.

Also, just wondering, could we use some of Romfarer's mods? And maybe DYJ's Gatling Cannon mod?

Out of curiosity, how many launches will this succession game allow? Most of my interplanetary missions have at least two launches, frequently more. Secondly, do we need to return the kethane to kerbin in order to achieve victory, and finally, are we allowed to sabotage other players' crafts as long as we don't take control of them or otherwise interfere? (i.e. by intercepting someone's orbiting kethane tanker with a kinetic kill vehicle)

If we're required to return the kethane to kerbin but can't sabotage other players, there's more or less no reason to go anywhere but minmus, given that the landing delta-V on minmus.

Personally I'd suggest giving each player a period of in game time to gather kethane rather than limiting them to 1 mission, I'm not sure what time frame would be best, but if you want interplanetary missions to be doable, I'd give people 6 months of in game time, or a full year if they need to return to kerbin with the kethane (if this is solely going to be within the kerbin system, 30 days should suffice), though you'll have to limit them to a certain number of launches to prevent someone from launching 50 kethane landers and strip mining minmus in that time.

Ultimately, it really depends on how much kethane you're expecting people to get, though I'd suggest between 5 and 10 launches allowed per turn...

And, given that you can apparently sabotage other players as long as you don't switch to their crafts (sorry, reading comprehension fail), I'd say go for around 5 launches maximum per turn.
